answers.answer: I weighed 125 before I got pregnant, then went down to 110 because I got so sick around 12 weeks. Now I'm 136 and 38+4 days pregnant. I have gestational diabetes but not over weight, and mine is completely under control.
I was 177 before and I'm 169 now at 16 weeks

I'm 34 weeks and have gained 34 lbs. I was a collegiate athlete and had a low body fat percentage. I eat healthy and exercise but the weight gain keeps coming. My doctor said as long as I am being healthy weight gain doesn't matter, because everyone gains differently.
Also, weight gain doesn't have to mean gestational diabetes. My numbers were excellent and I've gained a good amount of weight.
Gee y'all make me feel like i gained a ton../: lol i was 94 before pregnant now I'm 127. Still waiting for results I'm gestational diabetes. Fingers crossed I'm a ok.
Agrred ^ i was only 95 before pregnancy. My last appointment on july 3 i was 129.
I weighed 120 before I got pregnant, lost like 10 lbs in the beginning of my pregnancy due to bad nausea and vomitting. I'm now 26w4d and I weigh 120.

Before I was pregnant I was 158, and now I am 21 weeks and weigh 163. Which is a little on the lower side but my midwive said I'm ok and not to worry that I will get most my weight gain in my 3rd trimester.
Aww i was 113 before i was pregnant and went downto 110 now i gain 146. Isnt that a lot? :(

I was 203 and now at 40 weeks im 223, yes I am over weight. No i do not have GD and my blood pressure is EXCELENT, so just because you start off over weight doesnt mean you cant have a healthy pregnancy
I was 110 before my first pregnancy  and gained 50 - 55 pounds then I got pregnant 3 mnths later and I was 150 and im 13w and im 152

I'm with you newjulymommy,  I weighed more, lost 15 lbs in the 1st trimester and at 29w5d I have only gained a pound. But what u gain also depends on where you started, if u were considered underweight, on target or over weight. If your dr. Isn't stating you are gaining too much, then I wouldn't worry.Also, GD happens because of how ur body handles the insulin it produces while u r pregnant.  Pregnancy and the baby can actually block the insulin you produce.
I started at 115 and I am now at 130 and 25w 4d. With my first I gained 68lbs and I am trying my hardest not to gain that much again. I am hoping to only get up to 145 at most.

I was 180, excellent health, a lot of muscle, and i didn't have gestational diabetes. I had some fat here and there but for my bone structure i was healthy and looked like i was only 150. I'm now 199 at 26+4.
141 and now 145 at 13 weeks pluss 3 days.
I was 160 now 165 im 24 weeks
I started out at 125 went down to 120 now at 24 weeks I'm 131

At 11 weeks 153 and i dont know if that is my pre pregnancy weight but im pretty sure it is i doubt i was under 150. At 17 weeks im 157. Is 4lbs in 6 weeks a lot?? My doc said for now its ok but i dont want to gain that much in a month...

Pre-Pregnancy I weighed 112. @40 weeks I weighed 125lbs and my daughter was born at 6lbs 4oz. Dropped down to 108 due to breastfeeding. I wanted to keep the little weight though. It looked good on me, lol.

Started at 225 (still hadn't lost all my baby weight from last time) got down to 200 even because I was so sick.  Now at twenty six weeks I weigh just under 220 pounds. Hoping the highest I get this time is 230-240. (Got upto 260 with my daughter!)

question: What was your pre pregnancy weight and how much have you gain??A year ago I was 185 lbs, I lost 45 lbs and before getting pregnant I was 140, I now weight 150, I decided to lose weight because I didn't want to get gestational diabetes, but it seems as I'm still developing!
title: pre-pregnancy weight???
